where y
i (integrated ecological suitability index) refers to the comprehensive value of assessment of S. sphenanthera ecological suitability in each evaluation unit, n is the number of factors, w
j is the weight of a factor, and x
ij is the value of the ith grid cell for the jth variable. The scope of y
i was defined as 0–1. The higher the y
i value means the greater the contribution of ecological factors to the quality level of S. sphenanthera. We applied spatial analysis using ArcGIS 9.3 (Redlands, CA, USA) to calculate the raster and to set the cell size at the maximum of the inputs. Therefore, the maps of the habitat have a suitability assessment resolution of 30” (about 1 km 2).
